Reader Required: Adobe Reader, Adobe Digital Editions

Tested on the above readers with no problems on laptop and Android tablet.
Don't hesitate to PM me if you have any questions or problem with the download, as comments on the torrent are easy to miss.
Please allow a couple seconds for the seedboxes to kick in, then it should move pretty quick.
Enjoy! :D


Product Description

The bestselling guide to Exchange Server, fully updated for the newest version

Microsoft Exchange Server 2013 is touted as a solution for lowering the total cost of ownership, whether deployed on-premises or in the cloud. Like the earlier editions, this comprehensive guide covers every aspect of installing, configuring, and managing this multifaceted collaboration system. It offers Windows systems administrators and consultants a complete tutorial and reference, ideal for anyone installing Exchange Server for the first time or those migrating from an earlier Exchange Server version.

Microsoft Exchange Server 2013 is a messaging system that allows for access to e-mail, voicemail, and calendars from a variety of devices and any location, making it ideal for the enterprise
With more than 21,000 copies of earlier editions sold, this comprehensive guide offers systems administrators and consultants both a tutorial and a reference guide for installing and managing Exchange Server 2013
A team of Microsoft Certified Masters walks you step by step through planning and design, installation, administration and management, maintenance, and more

Mastering Microsoft Exchange Server 2013 is the complete reference for planning, installing, and maintaining the most popular e-mail server product available.
From the Back Cover

The In-Depth Information You Need

If you're responsible for installing, configuring, managing, and maintaining Microsoft Exchange Server 2013, start with this in-depth resource. Exchange Server MVP David Elfassy walks you carefully through what you need to know, including essential topics such as high availability, managing permissions and roles, creating mailbox databases, understanding the Client Access server role, and much more. You'll explore everything a robust cloud, hybrid, or onsite implementation has to offer, as well as how to evaluate the impact of virtualization. Even if you're familiar with previous versions of Exchange, you'll find valuable new information you can apply right away.

Coverage includes:

Exploring Exchange Server 2013 and Exchange fundamentals
Installing, upgrading, or migrating to Exchange Server 2013 or Office 365
Understanding services, server roles, configurations, requirements, and permissions
Managing mailbox databases, groups, mailboxes, contacts, and public folders
Creating and managing databases and understanding Client Access server
Understanding client connectivity and remote management of Exchange Server 2013
Troubleshooting, backing up, and restoring Exchange Server 2013

Plan, Install, Manage, and Maintain Exchange Server 2013

See What's In, What's Out from Earlier Exchange Versions

Integrate with SharePoint Server 2013 and Lync Server 2013

Get in the Cloud with Exchange Online and Office 365

Reinforce Your Skills with Real-World Examples
About the Author

David Elfassy, MCSE, MCITP, MCT, Exchange Server MVP, is an international presenter and trainer. He collaborates with Microsoft on certification, courseware, and key development projects. David is a project lead on many migrations and implementations of Microsoft infrastructure technologies for government and corporate organizations.

Contributors include: J. Peter Bruzzese, Chris Crandall, Adam Miceli, Bob Reinsch, Jeffrey Rosen, and Michael B. Smith.
